column3: As discussed in Note 3, 2008 and 2007 amounts have been recast due to Dominion's adoption of new accounting guidance for noncontrolling interests.

Net of income tax expense (benefit) of ($3) million and $115 million in 2008 and 2007, respectively. The 2007 expense includes $76 million and $56 million for U.S. federal and Canadian taxes, respectively, related to the gain on the sale of the Canadian E&P operations

Other comprehensive income for the year ended December 31, 2009 excludes a $20 million ($12 million after-tax) adjustment to AOCI representing the cumulative effect of the change in accounting principle related to the recognition and presentation of other-than-temporary impairments

Reflects a $259 million ($158 million after-tax) extraordinary charge in connection with the reapplication of accounting guidance for cost-based regulation, to the Virginia jurisdiction of Virginia Power's generation operations.
